meanings.definition: In a manner relating to conjugation.
meanings.sent1: She explained the grammar rule conjugationally to the students.
meanings.sent2: The verb was conjugationally changed to match the subject.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog conjugationally agreed to share the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: His ideas and hers conjugationally merged into a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The music flowed conjugationally, creating a harmonious melody.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves the inflection of verbs to show person, number, tense, mood, etc.
meanings.sent1: He spoke conjugationally to express his thoughts clearly.
meanings.sent2: The students conjugationally practiced changing verb endings.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden seemed to dance conjugationally in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions conjugationally shifted from joy to sadness.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset blended conjugationally in the sky.
